Find out how to become a councillor and stand in the 2 May elections

Visit the Culm Garden Village website for news and project updates

Popular actions for residents

Stay updated, stay informed!

Benefits

Car parking

Council Tax

Housing

Planning

Planning policy

Recycling & rubbish

We use cookies to help make this website work better. You can change your cookie settings at any time. I understand.

Watch out for council tax scam

We've received notification of a new council tax scam whereby recipients have received a text message allegedly from GOV.UK, claiming that 'Your Recent Council Tax Payment is overpaid' and signposting victims to https://govgroup.net.
Residents are urged not to reply, click on any links or disclose bank account details or any other personal information if contacted by anyone offering such a service...

Culm Garden Village

Visit our Culm Garden Village website to find out about the locally-led development project aiming to deliver up to 5,000 sustainable new homes in a country park landscape located to the east of Cullompton.

Stay updated, stay informed!

Save time and receive our latest news and service updates directly by signing up to our free email subscription service.

Worried your inbox will clog up with irrelevant content? Don't!
Only receive information on the council services that matter to you with our customisable preferences!

Could you be a councillor?

Are you interested in politics?
Would you like to make a difference by speaking up for your local community?

If so, why not become a councillor and stand for election in the upcoming district, town and parish council elections on 2 May 2019?

Switch and save using our energy switching service

UK residents pay over £1.4B extra on their energy bills because they don't switch to a cheaper tariff. Shop around for the best deals using our whole-of-market energy switching comparison service and see how much you can save.

(Brought to Mid Devon residents in association with Ofgem accredited UK Power).

Garden waste permit renewal

If you've already subscribed to our Garden waste service and your brown bin permit is nearing expiry, please see Garden waste permit renewal for information on how to renew.

Stay updated, stay informed!

Receive council news and alerts by signing up to our free email subscription service

Be Curious

Support this county-wide campaign to raise awareness of exploitation within communities

Benefits

Information on Housing Benefit, Council Tax Reduction, Fraud and Change of circumstances

Bereavement

Advice on arranging a funeral and information about cemeteries and memorials

Information on paying Council Tax, Charges and Bands, Discounts and Exemptions, Change of address

Culm Garden Village

Visit our new website to find out about a new settlement proposed near Cullompton

Dogs

For more information about dog related issues including lost & found dog, barking dogs, dog fouling, dangerous dogs and responsible dog ownership

Electric Nights Streetfood

Visit our award winning artisan night market website for event or trading information

Environment

Environmental issues such as street cleansing, contaminated land and more

Energy efficiency advice

Increase energy efficiency in your home and save money using our energy switching service

Grants and funding

Bringing more money into Mid Devon to help develop the local community

Gypsies and Travellers

Information regarding gypsies and travellers and related links

Housing

Information on all aspects of Housing

Jobs

Check here for employment opportunities to work with us

Leisure, parks and open spaces

Information on leisure centres, parks & play areas and skate parks & BMX tracks in Mid Devon

Lifeline alarms

Our Lifeline alarm service provides emergency assistance balanced with independent living

Local authority searches

Which type of search? To find out our fees and payment methods and you can submit your search here.

Payments

Make payments for Council Tax, Rents and more

Find out if you require planning permission and how to apply

Planning policy

Find out how we are helping to steer development in Mid Devon over the next 15 to 20 years

Privacy

View our Privacy Notice in line with the Data Protection Act 2018

Public health and regulatory services

Protecting and improving the health, safety and wellbeing of people in Mid Devon

Public toilets

A list of public toilets across Mid Devon and the facilities they provide

Recycling & rubbish

Information about our waste services including dates and frequencies of collections

Report an issue

Report problems in your area using our online forms, including dogs, ASB, missed bins, etc...

Roads and transport

Useful links to Devon County Council pages about roads in Mid Devon and links to assist you with you journey

Safeguarding

Responsible agencies to contact for concerns about child protection or vulnerable adults

Street and house naming

Information regarding street naming and numbering for builders/developers and householders

Street care

Information about litter bins, fly tipping, graffiti and abandoned vehicles

Tiverton Pannier Market

Visit our Tiverton Pannier Market website for information on traders and market events

Voting & elections

All you need to know about Elections, electoral registration and other elections

Mid Devon News Centre

Show previous news item. Show next news item.

Council features staff Upskilling...

Thu, 07 Mar 2019

Co-ordinated by the National Apprenticeship Service, National Apprenticeship Week 2019 (NAW 2019), has been showcasing the incredible opportunities undertaking a higher level business apprenticeship can bring. A range of activities and events have been hosted across the country, aimed at ...

Budget and council tax set for...

Thu, 28 Feb 2019

At a meeting of Mid Devon District Council’s full council last night (27 February 2019) Members set the budget for the financial year 2019/20 including the district precept for council tax. Next financial year the average Band D property will pay £203.84 to Mid Devon District Council, which is an ...

Trim-trail coming to Amory Park,...

Thu, 28 Feb 2019

A range of outdoor exercise equipment forming part of a ‘trim-trail’ is to be trialled in Amory Park, Tiverton. Scheduled for completion on Thursday, 28 February 2019, a total of seven pieces of equipment will be installed at the top of Amory Park, adjoining the BMX track.  The equipment selected ...

Power cut live test

Tue, 26 Feb 2019

On Monday, 25 February 2019 power to the main council building, Phoenix House, Tiverton was cut meaning access to emails, telephone systems and our website was unavailable. During this time our customers were unable to contact us in the usual way or make payments online or at our self-service ...

Power cut at Mid Devon District...

Mon, 25 Feb 2019

Update Following the power cut earlier today staff at Phoenix House are continuing to work hard to restore all our systems. We are still unable to access Customer Service emails or phone lines and our website is very limited. If you need to contact us in an emergency, during this time, please use ...

Council doubles council tax on...

Fri, 22 Feb 2019

Mid Devon District Council is set to double council tax premiums on long-term empty homes. Following a meeting of Full Council on 27th February 2019 the decision was approved as an incentive for owners of long-term empty properties to bring them back into use. The decision was previously ...

Council launches new weed removal...

Fri, 22 Feb 2019

As part of a new commitment to make the towns of Mid Devon safe and attractive for residents and visitors, the Council has prioritised the clearing of weeds in the centres of the three main towns in Mid Devon. Weed removal is normally a function of the Highways authority, however the ...

Council employee is braving the...

Thu, 21 Feb 2019

Customer First Officer, Levetta Cottrell, will be taking part in a 15,000ft sky dive in an effort to help raise money to send her niece abroad for ongoing cancer treatment. Levetta, who has worked for the council for almost 5 years, will be cheered on by a host of relatives as she undertakes the ...

J27 site and associated Sampford...

Wed, 20 Feb 2019

The final day of Mid Devon’s Local Plan Review Hearings has concluded at Phoenix House, Tiverton. During the day the Planning Inspector, Paul Griffiths, who is appointed by the Government to rule on the Mid Devon Local Plan Review, led a discussion on matters relating to the detailed wording of ...

Major Development Sites, Towns,...

Fri, 15 Feb 2019

The second day of Mid Devon’s Local Plan Review Hearings has concluded at Phoenix House. During the day the Planning Inspector, Paul Griffiths, who is appointed by the Government to rule on the Mid Devon Local Plan Review, discussed matters relating to the strategy for future development across Mid ...
